text: The February 2013 nor'easter (called by The Weather Channel as Winter Storm Nemo) was a large winter storm that formed from two low pressure areas and affected the northeastern United States and eastern Canada from February 7–10, 2013. The areas affect by the storm were between Virginia and Maine. The storm had hurricane strength winds, lightning, thunder, heavy snows and blizzard conditions. Boston received almost of snow due to this storm. New York City received almost one foot of new snow. It was Connecticut, however, that got the most. Hamden, Connecticut received almost , while nearby cities got at least . About 700,000 customers lost power. == Related pages == * North American blizzard of 2003 * December 2009 North American blizzard * December 2010 North American blizzard * January 31 – February 2, 2011 North American winter storm ==References== Category:2013 in the United States Category:2013 in Canada Category:2013 in weather Category:Natural disasters in the United States Category:2010s disasters in Canada Category:Natural disasters in Canada Category:February 2013 events Category:2010s disasters in the United States
title: February 2013 nor'easter
